action.action-desc: Mr. Torres of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit the communication of classified information on mobile or desktop messaging application, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Homeland Operations and Unilateral Tactics Halting Incursions: Preventing Coordinated Subversion, Military Aggression and Lawless Levies Granting Rogue Operatives Unchecked Power Act of 2025 or the HOUTHI PC SMALL GROUP Act of 2025.

section.header: Communication of classified information on mobile or desktop messaging application

subsection.text: Chapter 37 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 798A the following:

section.header: Communication of classified information on mobile or desktop messaging application
section.text: Whoever knowingly communicates, furnishes, transmits, or otherwise makes available any classified information on a mobile or desktop messaging application shall be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 10 years, or both.

subsection.text: The table of sections for chapter 37 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item related to section 798A the following:

toc.toc-entry: 798B. Communication of classified information on mobile or desktop messaging application.
